drug.name: Calcium glucoheptonate
drug.description: Calcium supplements such as calcium gluceptate are taken by individuals who are unable to get enough calcium in their regular diet or who have a need for more calcium. They are used to prevent or treat several conditions that may cause hypocalcemia (not enough calcium in the blood). The body needs calcium to make strong bones. Calcium is also needed for the heart, muscles, and nervous system to work properly.

article.citation: Drop LJ, Cullen DJ: Comparative effects of calcium chloride and calcium gluceptate. Br J Anaesth. 1980 May;52(5):501-5.

drug.indication: For treatment of mild hypocalcemia due to neonatal tetany, tetany due to parathyroid deficiency or vitamin D deficiency, and alkalosis, as prophylaxis of hypocalcemia during exchange transfusions, in the treatment of intestinal malabsorption, and to replenish electrolytes.
drug.pharmacodynamics: Calcium supplements such as calcium gluceptate are taken by individuals who are unable to get enough calcium in their regular diet or who have a need for more calcium. They are used to prevent or treat several conditions that may cause hypocalcemia (not enough calcium in the blood). The body needs calcium to make strong bones. Calcium is also needed for the heart, muscles, and nervous system to work properly. The bones serve as a storage site for the body's calcium. They are continuously giving up calcium to the bloodstream and then replacing it as the body's need for calcium changes from day to day. When there is not enough calcium in the blood to be used by the heart and other organs, your body will take the needed calcium from the bones. When you eat foods rich in calcium, the calcium will be restored to the bones and the balance between your blood and bones will be maintained.
drug.mechanism-of-action: Calcium gluceptate replenishes the deminished levels of calcium in the body, returning them to normal levels.
drug.toxicity: Symptoms of overdose include confusion, drowsiness (severe), high blood pressure, increased sensitivity of eyes or skin to light, irregular, fast, or slow heartbeat, and unusually large amount of urine or increased frequency of urination.

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as sugar acids and derivatives. These are compounds containing a saccharide unit which bears a carboxylic acid group.

product.name: Liquid Calcium
product.labeller: Wampole Brands, A Division Of Pangeo Pharma (Canada) Inc.

product.name: Sirop De Calcium 625mg/5ml
product.labeller: Therapex Division De E Z Em Canada Inc

drug-interaction.name: Ceftriaxone
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Calcium glucoheptonate is combined with Ceftriaxone.

drug-interaction.name: Deferiprone
drug-interaction.description: The serum concentration of Deferiprone can be decreased when it is combined with Calcium glucoheptonate.

drug-interaction.name: Dobutamine
drug-interaction.description: The therapeutic efficacy of Dobutamine can be decreased when used in combination with Calcium glucoheptonate.

drug-interaction.description: Calcium glucoheptonate can cause a decrease in the absorption of Estramustine resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy.

drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Calcium glucoheptonate is combined with Calcium acetate.
